Interface Section

All Known Implementing Classes:
Column, Region, Row
public interface Section

Represents a portion of the board that must be updated when a board square contained within this section is modified

Version:
May 11, 2017
Author:
Megan Tjandrasuwita

Method Summary
abstract  int findUniqueValue(Square[][] squares, Square s)
          Returns the possible value that is unique to one square in the section, if there is such a value.
abstract  int[] getPair(Square[][] square)
           
abstract  void processPair(Square[][] square, int[] pair)
           
abstract  void update(Square[][] square, Square aSquare)
          Updates the state of a square
 

Method Detail

findUniqueValue

int findUniqueValue(Square[][] squares,
                    Square s)
Returns the possible value that is unique to one square in the section, if there is such a value.

Parameters:
squares - the 2-D array of Squares, s the Square
Returns:
an integer between 1 to 9 that is a unique possible value; otherwise, if that value doesn't exist, returns -1

getPair

int[] getPair(Square[][] square)
Returns:
array of int of length two that contains the first pair of possible values that occur in two squares of this section; null if no such pair exists

processPair

void processPair(Square[][] square,
                 int[] pair)
Parameters:
array - of int of length two that contains pair of possible values; removes the two values from all squares not having the pair as their only possible values

update

void update(Square[][] square,
            Square aSquare)
Updates the state of a square

Parameters:
square - a 2-D array of Squares representing each Square on the sudoku board
aSquare - one Square on the sudoku board
